errors.error_description: The installation command `pip3 install git gud` is incorrect because it tries to install two separate packages, 'git' and 'gud', instead of the single 'git-gud' package.
The instructions incorrectly suggest running `git gud` before specifying that the command must be run inside a new empty directory, which can cause the tool to fail or modify an unintended directory.
correction_candidates: To get started, you need to initialize Git Gud in an empty directory. Once in the directory, run `git gud`.
To get started, first run `git gud init` in an empty directory.
Run `git gud` in a new directory to get started.
To get started, you need to initialize Git Gud in an empty directory.
errors.golden_answer: To get started, you need to initialize Git Gud in an empty directory.

errors.error_description: The 'How to install' section describes the Python requirement but omits the actual command needed to install the `git-gud` package using pip.
correction_candidates: After 'installing is simple:', add the line `pip3 install git-gud`.
After 'installing is simple:', add the command `python3 -m pip install git-gud`.
Change the `git gud` command block to `pip3 install git-gud`.

After 'installing is simple:', add the following block:
```
pip3 install git-gud
```
errors.golden_answer:
After 'installing is simple:', add the following block:
```
pip3 install git-gud
```

errors.error_description: Added instruction to download a configuration file from a non-existent path 'https://github.com/benthayer/git-gud/config/setup.yaml'
correction_candidates: Remove the instruction about downloading the configuration file entirely.
Make sure to clone the repository from https://github.com/benthayer/git-gud before installation.
Make sure to download the source code from https://github.com/benthayer/git-gud/releases before installation.
Make sure to check the documentation at https://github.com/benthayer/git-gud/blob/main/README.md before installation.
errors.golden_answer: Remove the instruction about downloading the configuration file entirely.
